articles.title: Mission
articles.contents:
Contents
Mission
Benefits

Mission
The Open Plant Pathology (OPP) initiative supports and promotes
openness, transparency and reproducibility of scientific research data
and methods applied to plant pathological research and applications. We
strongly believe that building a social infrastructure through a
welcoming, engaged and diverse community is key for sharing knowledge
and supporting others for adoption of a new culture.
Benefits
There may be several benefits from either following us or engaging
and promoting OPP:
Learn about open science/education and reproducible research in
the context of plant pathology
Meet new colleagues (who can become your future collaborators) by
joining
our Slack workspace who can help you out with any question
Academic and scientific exchange via freely available Virtual
Seminars on our YouTube
channel

articles.title: Team
articles.description: Get to know who has worked to make this possible
articles.contents:
OpenPlantPathology is a not for-profit initiative founded in January
2018 by Emerson Del
Ponte and Adam Sparks
to facilitate communication among computational plant pathologists and
promote open science and reproducible research practices in plant
pathology. Of course, this would not be possible without the support
from several colleagues who helped spread the initiative and the culture
of open science. Currently, our team is composed of the following
leaders.
Adam
Sparks
Founder. Webmaster
Senior Research Scientist, Bioeconomic Modeller
Department of Primary Industries and Regional Development (DPIRD),
Western Australia, Australia
Emerson Del
Ponte
Founder. Webdesigner
Plant Pathologist
Universidade Federal de Viçosa, Brazil
Lisa
Rothmann

University of the Free State, Bloemfontein South Africa

García-Bastidas

Kamvar

Technische Universität Dresden, Germany
